first_para: Dawn Petula Butler (born 3 November 1969) is a British Labour Party politician who was the Member of Parliament (MP) for Brent South from 2005 to 2010, and was Minister for Young Citizens and Youth Engagement  in the Cabinet Office. After her seat was abolished in boundary changes she stood as a candidate for the new Brent Central constituency, which she lost to Liberal Democrat Sarah Teather, polling 18,681 votes to Teather's 20,026.

full.extract: Dawn Petula Butler (born 3 November 1969) is a British Labour Party politician who was the Member of Parliament (MP) for Brent South from 2005 to 2010, and was Minister for Young Citizens and Youth Engagement  in the Cabinet Office. After her seat was abolished in boundary changes she stood as a candidate for the new Brent Central constituency, which she lost to Liberal Democrat Sarah Teather, polling 18,681 votes to Teather's 20,026.
full.title: Dawn Butler
